author: @waff48
title: Dense Fog will have a big impact on the morning commute
text:
Dense Fog will have a big impact on the morning commute
First Alert Weather
HUNTSVILLE, Ala. (WAFF) - For today, a Dense Fog Advisory through mid-morning. Reduced visibilities will have a big impact on the morning commute with visibilities less than a quarter of a mile. After the early morning fog, lots of clouds with a few showers later today. Mid to upper 70s. Tonight, showers are expected. Low temps in the 60s. Friday, scattered showers and thunderstorms. Severe weather is not likely, but periods of heavy rain are. Temps around 70 degrees. Friday night, the chance for rain continues overnight. Low 60s.
Saturday, early morning showers, then sunny during the afternoon. Low 70s. Saturday night, clear and cooler. Around 50 degrees. Sunday, a few clouds at times, otherwise nice. Mid to upper 60s.
Monday, a slight chance of a shower. Near 70 degrees. Tuesday, scattered showers. Near 70 degrees. Wednesday, a few showers. Low 60s. Thanksgiving Day and Black Friday, mainly sunny and cool. High temps only around 50 degrees, low temps in the upper 20s and low 30s.
